task.summary:
Add initial genetic algorithms and neural network configurations.
Introduced key components including PopulationEntry, calculator tests, NeuronalOperationNetConfiguration, and basic genetic algorithms interfaces. These additions lay the foundation for evolving neural network configurations using genetic algorithms.

Add initial project configuration and test setup
Initialized project files and configurations for IDE support, including gitignore rules and version control settings. Added test project setup with essential packages and references for NUnit testing framework.

Remove NamedBinOpNeuron and update tests with excellence samples
Deleted `NamedBinOpNeuron` class and introduced `NeuronConfig` for better structure. Updated test configurations to use new neuron structure and added handling for excellence samples with dynamic binary operations. Improved parallel processing in tests.

Add mutation runs property and improve evolution logic
Introduced a new `Runs` property to `MutationSetup`. Refactored mutation logic to include multiple runs and adjusted fitness evaluation. Updated tests and project configuration to align with these changes.

Add fitness evaluator and update genetic algorithm logic
Implemented IFitnessEvaluator interface for customizable fitness evaluation. Replaced direct fitness calculation with the new evaluator in Population class, added TrainingSample, and updated related tests. Included version bump and dependency update.

Refactor training logic in Population class
Consolidate parallel and single-threaded training methods into a unified Train method. The new implementation determines the appropriate evaluation function based on the number of threads, reducing code duplication and simplifying the logic.

Refactor fitness evaluation to include RNG and training flags
Updated the EvaluateFitness method to accept an RNG instance and a boolean flag to determine full sample set training. This change affects fitness evaluation in both serial and parallel contexts and improves training accuracy by allowing more controlled sample set usage. Additionally, updated project version to 0.4.14 and revised readme for clarity.

Remove DynamicBinOp and related network implementations
The entire DynamicBinOp module, including classes like BinOpNeuron, DboEvaluator, and FeedForwardNet, has been removed from the codebase. This change simplifies the overall structure and removes redundant or outdated neuronal network implementations. Future development will focus on more efficient and maintainable architectures.

MESSAGE.value:
Add initial genetic algorithms and neural network configurations.
Introduced key components including PopulationEntry, calculator tests, NeuronalOperationNetConfiguration, and basic genetic algorithms interfaces. These additions lay the foundation for evolving neural network configurations using genetic algorithms.

Add initial project configuration and test setup
Initialized project files and configurations for IDE support, including gitignore rules and version control settings. Added test project setup with essential packages and references for NUnit testing framework.

Remove NamedBinOpNeuron and update tests with excellence samples
Deleted `NamedBinOpNeuron` class and introduced `NeuronConfig` for better structure. Updated test configurations to use new neuron structure and added handling for excellence samples with dynamic binary operations. Improved parallel processing in tests.

Add mutation runs property and improve evolution logic
Introduced a new `Runs` property to `MutationSetup`. Refactored mutation logic to include multiple runs and adjusted fitness evaluation. Updated tests and project configuration to align with these changes.

Add fitness evaluator and update genetic algorithm logic
Implemented IFitnessEvaluator interface for customizable fitness evaluation. Replaced direct fitness calculation with the new evaluator in Population class, added TrainingSample, and updated related tests. Included version bump and dependency update.

Refactor training logic in Population class
Consolidate parallel and single-threaded training methods into a unified Train method. The new implementation determines the appropriate evaluation function based on the number of threads, reducing code duplication and simplifying the logic.

Refactor fitness evaluation to include RNG and training flags
Updated the EvaluateFitness method to accept an RNG instance and a boolean flag to determine full sample set training. This change affects fitness evaluation in both serial and parallel contexts and improves training accuracy by allowing more controlled sample set usage. Additionally, updated project version to 0.4.14 and revised readme for clarity.

Remove DynamicBinOp and related network implementations
The entire DynamicBinOp module, including classes like BinOpNeuron, DboEvaluator, and FeedForwardNet, has been removed from the codebase. This change simplifies the overall structure and removes redundant or outdated neuronal network implementations. Future development will focus on more efficient and maintainable architectures.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Remove DynamicBinOp and related network implementations
The entire DynamicBinOp module, including classes like BinOpNeuron, DboEvaluator, and FeedForwardNet, has been removed from the codebase. This change simplifies the overall structure and removes redundant or outdated neuronal network implementations. Future development will focus on more efficient and maintainable architectures.
